intro: Psychotria xerococcoides, commonly known as the desert psychotria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability. Its botanical features make it a unique species within its ecological niche.
